questions.question_text:
A user wants to create a set of filter conditions, where they want to show records which satisfy two conditions:
✑ Incidents where the state is Closed
✑ Incidents where Assignment Group is Network
After clicking the Funnel icon, what should the user do?

discussion.content: clearly A" is the answer

Selected Answer: A
AND is for satisfying both

Selected Answer: A
"AND" is correct, is used coz u need to meet both conditions

choices.E: Define the first condition; click > icon on breadcrumb, define second condition; press enter
choices.C: Define the first condition; click OR button; define second condition; press enter
choices.B: Define the first condition; click AND button; define second condition; press enter
choices.D: Define the first condition; click > icon on breadcrumb, define second condition; click Run
choices.A: Define the first condition; click AND button; define second condition; click Run

discussion.content: what's the difference between A and E ??? looks same/

Selected Answer: E
E is correct

Incident field?

In Tokyo, the catalog item can be associated with more than one catalog. Open a catalog item, scroll to the bottom reference list, select Catalog tab, add multiple catalog references. Maybe the design changed since this question was added?

questions.question_text:
Two departments (HR Onboarding and Facilities) have come to you, asking for a way for employees to request event room set up services. The requirements are the same for the form and the task routing to the Facilities' assignment group.
✑ For HR, the item will be used primarily for the Onboarding coordinators, for employee orientation sessions.
✑ For Facilities, the item will be used for anyone in the company who needs room set up services.
However, both departments have their own service catalogs. What do you do, to support these requirements?

choices.A: Create one Catalog Item for HR Event Room Set Up and one for Facilities Event Room Set Up; then publish each to the appropriate Catalog.
choices.B: Create one Catalog Item for Event Room Set Up; then publish to both Catalogs.
choices.D: Create one Catalog Item for Event Room Set Up; then use ACLs to control access.
choices.C: Create one Catalog Item for Event Room Set Up; then publish to the Parent Catalog, which is accessible to both HR and Facilities.
Use System Administration > Normal Security module

questions.question_text: After finishing your work on High Security Settings, what do you do to return to normal admin security levels?

discussion.content: In Tokyo, you select Elevate Role under the user menu then uncheck security_admin and click update. So, while the terminology is wrong, A is (now) the most correct answer

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer for the Washington DC release. 

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/csh?topicname=t_ElevateToAPrivilegedRole.html&version=latest
User Menu then Elevate Role and switch on/off security_admin

Selected Answer: B
The elevated role will end when you log out(UTAH)

Selected Answer: B
While in Tokyo you can just deselect the security_admin role and click update. But according to the ServiceNow Administration Fundamentals - Tokyo booklet, page 13 states "the elevated role will end when you log out." For testing I would suggest B

In Vancover it is provided: This role grants the user elevated privileges to all resources controlled by the role for the remainder of the session. When the user logs out, the elevated privileges are terminated with the session but may be reestablished at the next login.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-platform-security/page/administer/security/task/t_ElevateToAPrivilegedRole.html

Quote from Prompt to use the Elevated Role:
Elevate role

Elevate a role by adding privileges, which end when you log out. Learn more

AVAILABLE ROLES

security_admin
Grant modification access to High Security Settings, allow user to modify the Access Control List

"Elevate a role by adding privileges, which end when you log out"

San Diego
Could this question be outdated? At least in Utah I would go User Menu -> Elevate Role and switch on/off security_admin

Selected Answer: B
Log out and in.

B. Log out and back in

https://www.servicenow.com/community/developer-articles/use-of-look-up-select-box-variable-on-service-catalog/ta-p/2330117
A - why is there a link to a Microsoft page as (wrong) reference in the provided answer. Did the mix up questions from another exam ?

Selected Answer: A
A. Reference

A Reference field in ServiceNow is used to establish a relationship between two tables. It enables you to select a record from another table, and the reference field displays the values from the referenced table. This functionality allows for data consistency and linking records across different tables.

Selected Answer: A
